name: Merrow
description: A large aquatic creature with a fish-like lower body, long claws, and jagged teeth, embodying a corrupted form of Merfolk.
memorable: Known for dragging victims underwater to drown, embodying a fierce predator of the ocean depths.
goals: Prey on ships, coastal villages, and Merfolk; hunt relentlessly in their aquatic domain.
relations: Often found in the company of other aquatic terrors or as a servitor to malevolent sea deities.
environment: Deep waters, near coastal areas, and shipwrecks.
strengths: High strength allows for powerful melee attacks; amphibious nature enables versatility in combat.
weaknesses: Low intelligence and charisma, making it ineffective for cunning or charm-based tactics.
attacks: Uses claws for slashing damage with grappling mechanics; harpoons for both melee and ranged attacks that can pull enemies closer.
most_powerful_ability: Grappling mechanics combined with harpoon usage to control and reposition enemies strategically.
senses: Has darkvision that allows it to see in low-light conditions.
skills: Average perception, enabling it to detect intruders in its environment.
additional_information: Can breathe underwater and on land due to amphibious trait.
Resistant to exhaustion and frightened conditions, enhancing its durability in combat.
Multiattack capability allows for multiple assaults in a single turn.
test_queries: brutal predator that drags victims underwater
large creature dwelling in deep waters
monster that uses harpoons in combat
